newsitem.title: UK: Both Brent dates kept - trade.
newsitem.headline: Both Brent dates kept - trade.

text.p: The two Brent cargoes nominated from the paper chains on Tuesday were both kept ahead of the five o'clock deadline, traders said.
One cargo was kept by BP and the other by Stasco, they said.
The cargoes are due to load March 19-21. One was a full cargo from the original loading programme and the other was put together from top-ups.
Brent cargoes are traded on a paper, or forward market until the 1700 London time deadline on the nearest trading day 15 days before their assigned loading date.
A trading company is clocked when it is left with a paper cargo which has turned physical after that deadline and therefore cannot be passed on as part of pre-sold paper cargo deals.
